text: Music bit of a hectic market today I want to talk through a couple broader Concepts on what I saw going on today to share with you all and then I want to take a look specifically at a handful of questions I got on GameStop as I'm always happy to look and share what I can see with you all so what happened today a couple things the major thing I noticed was this broad rotation in movement of capital because if we take a look across the primary indices the SPX literally gapped down that's not crazy but it's not common if you go back through this chart and you look for periods where this is over the last six months where it actually gapped down like this it's not super frequent that it makes those kinds of movements the SPX spy whichever you want to use it tends to be a little slower than that so we were at a just crazy high level the I wouldn't start freaking out when you see something come off a high and go into a consolidation that's a very normal behavior I feel like sometimes people get so used to things kind of going this parabolic up that we forget that there are other directions so that's one thing I saw the other thing I saw was when I look across technology using the NASDAQ as a proxy it took way more of the brunt and that's probably because Tech

is you're going to come across this all the time this appeal to Authority I know somebody that's a market maker I know somebody that's at a prop firm I know this I know that I have this tool I have that tool that's not to say you should ever dismiss those data points they're still viable data points but they're not necessarily the Arbiter of Truth or some sort of forcing function that's really unique to that scenario it's not never the case but it's rarely the case especially with something like GameStop the longer I look at this the more I find there's tons of people trying to make guesses about when we're going to see some sort of big move because it's fun right but the problem with that is you can come across a lot of really convincing arguments that just don't pan out because the market doesn't care the market doesn't care how good a hypothesis is to see these kinds of moves you need very specific conditions to merge and sometimes they're very difficult to pick up on ahead of time I definitely didn't top tick any of these I didn't get into this at 10 and out at 6483 it's super difficult to do that kind of stuff so what I would recommend to people is the digestion of information is good being open to information is good but coming out and then asking which I literally had people send me um different

at 10 and out at 6483 it's super difficult to do that kind of stuff so what I would recommend to people is the digestion of information is good being open to information is good but coming out and then asking which I literally had people send me um different Snippets of I I didn't see the post but different Snippets about that post and there has asking if they should buy Super far out of the money short-term calls for this week predicated on that information which you probably already know my response to that I chuckle because it's hilarious I think like what a difficult way to make money in this business long-term doing something like that it's so low probability but I always go back to you got to do what's right for you but what I would encourage people to do is be receptive to information always be skeptical healthy skeptical meaning requiring a certain level of validation so for example Bloomberg terminals are really cool I've messed with them for a long time there's a lot of great data in there there's nothing magical in there there's no secret Edge that's baked into a Bloomberg terminal there's literally thousands of people that are on there every day looking for them so for example I know that they were referencing swaps you can see the swaps so we know that they're there it's not this insanely impactful Insider information that nobody knows it's somebody that's talking

so that matters because it exhibits a little bit less conviction than had they been single trades the whole point of trading verticals is to decrease the sensitivity of the position and the positions that I saw got put on were really interesting it looked like a mix of 40s 45s and 50s so what I mean by that is if we take a look at these Series right you can see that there's a bunch of 30s came through at the 40 puts and then you can see that there's blocks of 15s that came through at the 45s so if I sort these by time you'll see a few things you'll see that a lot of these traded around one another near the same time as they were being filled the other thing is if you click these little arrows they're really useful here actually they help us identify things so for example I can see 15 of the 40 puts came through at the mid and then I can see 15 of the 45 puts came through at the bid at the same exact time at the same exact size that again tells me that these two are overwhelmingly likely tied to one another and it looks like a 40 45 put spread and for these if the bid is at the 45 that means we're selling this one the 45 is the further in the money in this case and then we're buying the closer to
